isis.stitle: T 444E Diesel Engine Diagnostics (1997) - SECTION 2.2: HARD START/NO START DIAGNOSTICS - T 444E ENGINE - ECM VOLTAGE

svcprocinfo.para:
Refer to Table 2.12
for the ECM Voltage Check of the diagnostic form.

entry.para: □ If voltage is low, refer to ECM diagnostics

svcsubproc.title: Purpose
svcsubproc.para: To determine if there is sufficient voltage and current to operate the Electronic Control Module (ECM) and Injector Drive Module (IDM). The ECM and IDM require 7 volts minimum to operate and drive the injectors. This is an alternate method to be used if the Electronic Service Tool (EST) is unavailable or fails to function properly. Insufficient electrical power from the batteries or an electronic failure may inhibit the EST from receiving diagnostic data.

step1.para: Connect a DVOM (Digital Volt Ohm Meter) across the battery terminals.
Turn all accessories off and turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
Wait for the glow plug system to cycle, then crank the engine.

Record the lowest voltage obtained during engine cranking. If the voltage is below 7 volts, the IDM and ECM power relays may be resetting due to the lack of voltage and current from the batteries or a problem exists in the starting system.
If voltage is within specification, perform Voltage Measurement At The ECM Relay.

svcsubproc.title: Voltage Measurement At The ECM Relay
svcsubproc.para: The ECM power relay is located (Refer to Section 7, Vehicle and Component Illustrations)on the engine cowl and mounted on a bracket over the IDM.

step1.para: Connect a DVOM (+ lead) to terminal 87( wire 97AR) of the ECM relay and the (- lead) to battery ground.
Turn all accessories off and turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position.
Wait for the glow plug system to cycle, then crank the engine.
Observe and record voltage while engine is cranking.

If no voltage is present at terminal 87(wire 97AR), refer to Electronic Control Module Power Supply (ECM PWR) in (Section 3.5) Electronic Control System Diagnostics. If voltage is 7 or more volts, proceed with voltage check using the breakout box.

svcsubproc.title: Voltage Measurement At ECM With Breakout Box
svcsubproc.para:
Refer to Figure 2.21
for an illustration of the Breakout Box.

step1.para: Remove the weather cover at the engine cowl located on the upper driver's side of vehicle.
Remove the 60 way connector from the ECM. Attach the adapter of the breakout box to the ECM and secure the bolt in the center of the adapter.
Reattach the 60 way connector to the adapter and secure the bolt in the center of the plug to the adapter.
Connect the positive lead of the voltmeter to terminal 57 and the negative lead to terminal 40 on the breakout box.
Turn the ignition switch to the "ON" position. Wait for the glow plug system to cycle, then crank the engine. Record the lowest voltage observed while cranking engine.
If voltage is lower than 7 volts, repair the ECM power feed circuit. Refer to Electronic Control Module Power Supply (ECM PWR) in (Section 3.5) Electronic Control System Diagnostics.

item.para: Low battery voltage. Due to "faulty" batteries, high resistance at battery cable connections or defective starter.

Low or no battery voltage to the ECM. - May be due to high resistance or an open circuit in the power feed circuit to the ECM or it's power relay. The ECM power circuit fuse, F5, may be open or the ECM power relay may be defective.
Refer to Electronic Control Module Power Supply (ECM PWR) in (Section 3.5) Electronic Control System Diagnostics.
